illustratedStories.title: Illustrated Stories
illustratedStories.description: A curated collection of short illustrated stories and morals from Indian tradition. Click a story to read its summary and moral.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Clever Rabbit and the Lion
kids_indian_stories.summary: A small rabbit outsmarts a fierce lion by tricking him into jumping into a well after seeing his reflection.
kids_indian_stories.imgAlt: The Clever Rabbit and the Lion

kids_indian_stories.title: The Monkey and the Crocodile
kids_indian_stories.summary: A monkey avoids danger by tricking a crocodile that tries to eat his heart.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Thirsty Crow
kids_indian_stories.moral: Where there is a will, there is a way.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A thirsty crow drops pebbles into a pot to raise the water level and drinks it.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Foolish Lion and the Clever Fox
kids_indian_stories.summary: A fox fools a lion into entering a deserted cave and the lion gets trapped forever.
kids_indian_stories.imgAlt: The Foolish Lion and the Clever Fox

kids_indian_stories.title: The Talkative Tortoise
kids_indian_stories.moral: Talking too much can lead to trouble.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A tortoise falls from the sky because he opens his mouth while being carried by two birds.

kids_indian_stories.title: Tenali Rama and the Thieves
kids_indian_stories.moral: Smart thinking can save your home.
kids_indian_stories.summary: Tenali Rama tricks thieves by pretending to clean his well all night while dropping stones into it.

kids_indian_stories.title: Birbal’s Khichdi Story
kids_indian_stories.moral: Patience and presence of mind win.
kids_indian_stories.summary: Birbal proves that thinking about heat from far away is the same as warming food from far away.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Loyal Mongoose
kids_indian_stories.summary: A mongoose saves a baby from a snake, but is punished by mistake.

kids_indian_stories.title: Krishna and the Butter Pot
kids_indian_stories.moral: Curiosity and playfulness are natural, but honesty matters.
kids_indian_stories.summary: Baby Krishna steals butter with his friends and charms everyone with his innocence.

kids_indian_stories.title: Sudama and Krishna
kids_indian_stories.summary: Poor Sudama visits Krishna with a humble gift, and Krishna showers him with love and blessings.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Elephant and the Tailor
kids_indian_stories.moral: Kindness returns kindness; cruelty returns cruelty.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A tailor pricks an elephant, and the elephant throws muddy water on him in revenge.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Wise Parrot
kids_indian_stories.summary: A parrot warns a king about his kingdom’s dangers and becomes his trusted friend.

kids_indian_stories.title: Shravan Kumar’s Devotion
kids_indian_stories.summary: Shravan Kumar cares for his blind parents and becomes a symbol of devotion.

kids_indian_stories.title: Ganesha and the Mango
kids_indian_stories.summary: Ganesha wins a contest by circling his parents instead of the world.

kids_indian_stories.title: The King and the Sparrow
kids_indian_stories.summary: A sparrow helps a king learn humility.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Golden Swan
kids_indian_stories.summary: A golden swan gives feathers to a poor family, but greed ruins everything.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Hungry Mouse
kids_indian_stories.summary: A mouse becomes stuck in a hole after overeating.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Lion and the Mouse
kids_indian_stories.moral: Even the small can help the mighty.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A lion spares a mouse and the mouse rescues the lion later.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Wise Carpenter
kids_indian_stories.summary: A carpenter peacefully resolves a land dispute using clever planning.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Magic Drum
kids_indian_stories.summary: A kind boy receives a magic drum that creates food and toys.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Brave Little Sparrow
kids_indian_stories.summary: A sparrow saves her children from a huge elephant.

kids_indian_stories.title: Arjuna and the Bird’s Eye
kids_indian_stories.summary: Arjuna impresses his guru by focusing solely on a bird’s eye.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Crooked Tree
kids_indian_stories.moral: Be content with who you are.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A crooked tree survives woodcutters because of its shape.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Magic Pot
kids_indian_stories.moral: Good things come to good people.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A farmer finds a pot that doubles anything he puts inside.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Kind Deer
kids_indian_stories.summary: A deer king saves a doe and earns the king’s respect.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Flying Elephant
kids_indian_stories.summary: An elephant with wings loses them after misusing his powers.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Pot of Wisdom
kids_indian_stories.summary: A boy learns that no one can hold all wisdom alone.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Magic Fish
kids_indian_stories.summary: A fisherman catches a magical fish that offers help in return for freedom.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Coconut and the Ant
kids_indian_stories.summary: Ants join together to help a coconut reach the sea.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Tiger and the Woodcutter
kids_indian_stories.moral: Help others and you will be helped.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A woodcutter frees a trapped tiger who surprisingly spares his life.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Two Cats and the Monkey
kids_indian_stories.moral: Don’t let others settle your fights.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A monkey eats the bread while pretending to divide it fairly for two cats.
kids_indian_stories.imgAlt: The Two Cats and the Monkey

kids_indian_stories.title: The Sparrow and the Sea
kids_indian_stories.summary: A sparrow threatens the sea when it takes her eggs, inspiring Lord Rama.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Boy Who Cried Tiger
kids_indian_stories.summary: A boy fools villagers but suffers when a tiger really appears.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Magic Banyan Tree
kids_indian_stories.summary: A tree gives fruit, shade, and gold coins to a kind traveler.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Curious Peacock
kids_indian_stories.summary: A peacock wants a nightingale’s voice but learns beauty has its own charm.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Clever Weaver
kids_indian_stories.summary: A weaver fools a ghost and becomes rich.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Fruits of Hard Work
kids_indian_stories.summary: Two brothers learn that effort matters more than luck.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Little Drum
kids_indian_stories.summary: A boy is gifted a drum that brings happiness wherever he goes.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Donkey and the Tiger Skin
kids_indian_stories.moral: Pretending to be someone else leads to trouble.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A donkey wears a tiger skin but ruins everything by braying.
kids_indian_stories.imgAlt: The Donkey and the Tiger Skin

kids_indian_stories.title: The Hidden Treasure
kids_indian_stories.summary: A father tricks his sons into farming by telling them treasure lies buried in the field.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Brave Parrot
kids_indian_stories.summary: A parrot tries to save a burning forest and inspires the gods.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Boy and the Drum
kids_indian_stories.moral: Small gifts can make a big difference.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A boy uses a drum to spread happiness.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Mouse Merchant
kids_indian_stories.summary: A man becomes rich starting with a single mouse.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Talking Cave
kids_indian_stories.summary: A lion hides in a cave and a clever jackal avoids danger.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Greedy Barber
kids_indian_stories.summary: A barber loses all his riches because of greed.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Milkmaid’s Dream
kids_indian_stories.moral: Don’t count your chickens before they hatch.
kids_indian_stories.summary: A milkmaid dreams of riches and spills her milk.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Magical Sparrow
kids_indian_stories.summary: A sparrow helps a farmer and his crops grow magically.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Wise Old Elephant
kids_indian_stories.summary: An elderly elephant guides his herd to safety during drought.

kids_indian_stories.title: The Lotus and the Frog
kids_indian_stories.summary: A lotus teaches a restless frog to slow down.

kids_indian_stories.title: The King Who Ate Too Many Sweets
kids_indian_stories.summary: A king overeats sweets and learns to control his cravings.
kids_indian_stories.imgAlt: The King Who Ate Too Many Sweets
